ratings.question_text: Overall, how would you rate the workload of this course in comparison to other Yale courses you have taken?
What is your overall assessment of this course?
Do you expect to use this class for credit toward your major, or toward a pre-professional program?

narratives.question_text: How would you summarize ECON 110 05 for a fellow student? Would you recommend ECON 110 05 to another student? Why or why not?
comments: Well, if you need to take it for the econ major, obviously do. If you are taking it for the heck of it, take it with Sigga

In the lectures, Alonso greatly summarizes the context of every chapter and reads it verbatim in class which makes the book less necessary. I would definitely recommend this course because students learn the economics that is constantly on the news, the only probably is you have to take micro first.

This is a do-it-yourself type of class, which you should be very good at by the time you've gotten to Yale (and if not, this might be a good time to try it). There's no real value in going to class because the ppt slides you get correspond exactly with what Alonso is saying. Office hours were pointless and unhelpful. However, if I'm not mistaken the curve is more generous than the Lecture equivalent. Overall, I wouldn't recommend the course unless you have some background knowledge or like to teach yourself.
I would take the seminar if you are an aspiring econ major.
